00020 =head1 NAME
00021 
00022 WeBWorK::DB::Schema::NewSQL::Versioned - provide access to versioned sets.

00026 use strict;
00027 use warnings;
00028 use WeBWorK::DB::Utils qw/make_vsetID make_vsetID_sql
00029     grok_setID_from_vsetID_sql grok_versionID_from_vsetID_sql/;
00030 
00031 use constant TABLES => qw/set_version problem_version/;

00033 ################################################################################
00034 # where clause
00035 ################################################################################
00036 
00037 # Override where clause generators that can be used with versioned sets so that
00038 # they only match versioned sets.
00039 
00040 sub where_DEFAULT {
00041     my ($self, $flags) = @_;
00042     return {set_id=>{LIKE=>make_vsetID("%","%")}};
00043 }
00044 
00045 # replaces where_versionedset_user_id_eq in NewSQL
00046 sub where_user_id_eq {
00047     my ($self, $flags, $user_id) = @_;
00048     return {user_id=>$user_id,set_id=>{LIKE=>make_vsetID("%","%")}};
00049 }
00050 
00051 sub where_user_id_like {
00052     my ($self, $flags, $user_id) = @_;
00053     return {user_id=>{LIKE=>$user_id},set_id=>{LIKE=>make_vsetID("%","%")}};
00054 }
00055 
00056 sub where_set_id_eq {
00057     my ($self, $flags, $set_id) = @_;
00058     return {set_id=>{LIKE=>make_vsetID($set_id,"%")}};
00059 }
00060 
00061 # replaces where_versionedset_user_id_eq_set_id_eq in NewSQL
00062 sub where_user_id_eq_set_id_eq {
00063     my ($self, $flags, $user_id, $set_id) = @_;
00064     return {user_id=>$user_id,set_id=>{LIKE=>make_vsetID($set_id,"%")}};
00065 }
00066 
00067 # replaces where_versionedset_user_id_eq_set_id_eq_version_id_le in NewSQL
00068 sub where_user_id_eq_set_id_eq_version_id_le {
00069     my ($self, $flags, $user_id, $set_id, $version_id) = @_;
00070     if ($version_id >= 1) {
00071         my @vsetIDs = map { make_vsetID($set_id,$_) } 1 .. $version_id;
00072         return {user_id=>$user_id,set_id=>\@vsetIDs};
00073     } else {
00074         # nothing matches an invalid version id
00075         return {-and=>\("0==1")};
00076     }
00077 }
00078 
00079 sub where_user_id_eq_set_id_eq_version_id_eq {
00080     my ($self, $flags, $user_id, $set_id, $version_id) = @_;
00081     if ($version_id >= 1) {
00082         return {user_id=>$user_id,set_id=>make_vsetID($set_id,$version_id)};
00083     } else {
00084         # nothing matches an invalid version id
00085         return {-and=>\("0==1")};
00086     }
00087 }
00088 
00089 # for problem versions only (set versions don't have a problem_id field)
00090 sub where_user_id_eq_set_id_eq_problem_id_eq {
00091     my ( $self, $flags, $user_id, $set_id, $problem_id ) = @_;
00092     return {user_id=>$user_id,set_id=>{LIKE=>make_vsetID($set_id,"%")},problem_id=>$problem_id};
00093 }
00094 
00095 ################################################################################
00096 # override sql_field_expression to return SUBSTRING(...) expressions
00097 ################################################################################
00098 
00099 # FIXME the rest of the places in this class that generate field lists (basically
00100 # anywhere that calls grok_*_from_vsetID_sql), should call this method instead.
00101 # this method can handle if the set_id field has a fieldOverride set for it, and
00102 # the other methods can't.
00103 sub sql_field_expression {
00104     my ($self, $field, $table) = @_;
00105     
00106     if ($field eq "set_id" or $field eq "version_id") {
00107         # this value will already be properly quoted
00108         my $sql_field_name = $self->SUPER::sql_field_expression("set_id", $table);
00109         
00110         if ($field eq "set_id") {
00111             return grok_setID_from_vsetID_sql($sql_field_name);
00112         } elsif ($field eq "version_id") {
00113             return grok_versionID_from_vsetID_sql($sql_field_name);
00114         }
00115     } else {
00116         return $self->SUPER::sql_field_expression($field, $table);
00117     }
00118 }
00119 
00120 # FIXME sql_field_expression will work in WHERE clauses, but do we need an
00121 # analogous routine for SET lvalues?
00122 
00123 ################################################################################
00124 # override keyparts_to_where to limit scope of where clauses
00125 ################################################################################
00126 
00127 sub keyparts_to_where {
00128     my ($self, @keyparts) = @_;
00129     
00130     my $where = $self->SUPER::keyparts_to_where(@keyparts);
00131     
00132     if (exists $where->{set_id} and exists $where->{version_id}) {
00133         $where->{set_id} = make_vsetID($where->{set_id}, $where->{version_id});
00134         delete $where->{version_id};
00135     } else {
00136         my $set_id_part = exists $where->{set_id} ? $where->{set_id} : "%";
00137         my $version_id_part = exists $where->{version_id} ? $where->{version_id} : "%";
00138         $where->{set_id} = {LIKE => make_vsetID($set_id_part, $version_id_part)};
00139         delete $where->{version_id};
00140     }
00141     
00142     return $where;
00143 }

00149 # replace the virutal set_id and version_id fields with expressions that extract
00150 # the set and version IDs from the real set_id field
00151 sub _get_fields_where_prepex {
00152     my ($self, $fields, $where, $order) = @_;
00153     
00154     if (ref $fields eq "ARRAY") {
00155         my @fields = @$fields; # don't want to mess up caller's copy
00156         foreach my $field (@fields) {
00157             if (lc $field eq "set_id") {
00158                 # FIXME use sql_field_expression here
00159                 $field = grok_setID_from_vsetID_sql($self->sql->_quote("set_id"))
00160                     . " AS " . $self->sql->_quote("set_id");
00161             } elsif (lc $field eq "version_id") {
00162                 # FIXME use sql_field_expression here
00163                 $field = grok_versionID_from_vsetID_sql($self->sql->_quote("set_id"))
00164                     . " AS " . $self->sql->_quote("version_id");
00165             } else {
00166                 $field = $self->sql->_quote($field);
00167             }
00168         }
00169         $fields = join(", ", @fields);
00170     }
00171     
00172     return $self->SUPER::_get_fields_where_prepex($fields, $where, $order);
00173 }
00174 
00175 # modify the INSERT expression so that it looks like this:
00176 # INSERT ... SET (..., set_id, ...) VALUES (..., CONCAT(?,',v',?), ...)
00177 # this is mostly a copy of Std::_insert_fields_prep
00178 sub _insert_fields_prep {
00179     my ($self, $fields) = @_;
00180     
00181     # we'll use dummy values to determine bind order
00182     my %values;
00183     @values{@$fields} = (0..@$fields-1);
00184     
00185     # VERSIONING
00186     if (exists $values{set_id} and exists $values{version_id}) {
00187         # the array form allows raw SQL and bind values
00188         $values{set_id} = [make_vsetID_sql("?","?"), @values{qw/set_id version_id/}];
00189         delete $values{version_id};
00190     } elsif (exists $values{set_id} or exists $values{version_id}) {
00191         die "can't re-create versioned set_id field without virtual set_id and version_id fields";
00192     } else {
00193         # neither set_id nor version_id present, so that's fine
00194         # (fine with us that is, mysql will complain that keys are missing)
00195     }
00196     
00197     my ($stmt, @order) = $self->sql->insert($self->table, \%values);
00198     my $sth = $self->dbh->prepare_cached($stmt, undef, 3); # 3: see DBI docs
00199     return $sth, @order;
00200 }
00201 
00202 # where clause is already in native format (see where subroutines above)
00203 # fieldvals (a hashref) might contain decomposed set_id/version_id fields
00204 # set_id value:
00205 #   +set_id, +version_id => CONCAT(?, ',v', ?) BIND: set_id, version_id
00206 #   +set_id, -version_id => CONCAT(?, ',v', grok_versionID_from_vsetID_sql("set_id")) BIND: set_id
00207 #   -set_id, +version_id => CONCAT(grok_setID_from_vsetID_sql("set_id", ',v', ?) BIND: version_id
00208 #   -set_id, -version_id => not included
00209 sub update_where {
00210     my ($self, $fieldvals, $where) = @_;
00211     
00212     my %fieldvals = %$fieldvals; # don't want to mess up the caller's version
00213     
00214     if (exists $fieldvals{set_id} or exists $fieldvals{version_id}) {
00215         my ($set_id_part, $version_id_part, @bind);
00216         if (exists $fieldvals{set_id}) {
00217             $set_id_part = "?";
00218             push @bind, $fieldvals{set_id};
00219         } else {
00220             # FIXME use sql_field_expression here?
00221             $set_id_part = grok_setID_from_vsetID_sql($self->sql->_quote("set_id"));
00222         }
00223         if (exists $fieldvals{version_id}) {
00224             $version_id_part = "?";
00225             push @bind, $fieldvals{version_id};
00226         } else {
00227             # FIXME use sql_field_expression here?
00228             $version_id_part = grok_versionID_from_vsetID_sql($self->sql->_quote("set_id"));
00229         }
00230         $fieldvals{set_id} = [make_vsetID_sql($set_id_part, $version_id_part), @bind];
00231         delete $fieldvals{version_id};
00232     }
00233     
00234     $self->SUPER::update_where(\%fieldvals, $where);
00235 }
00236 
00237 # this is mostly a copy of Std::_update_fields_prep
00238 sub _update_fields_prep {
00239     my ($self, $fields) = @_;
00240     
00241     # get hashes to pass to update() and where()
00242     # (dies if any keyfield is missing from @$fields)
00243     my ($values, $where) = $self->gen_update_hashes($fields);
00244     
00245     # grab bind order for set_id/version_id virtual fields
00246     my $set_id_index = $where->{set_id};
00247     my $version_id_index = $where->{version_id};
00248     delete @$where{qw/set_id version_id/};
00249     
00250     # do the where clause separately so we get a separate bind list (cute substr trick, huh?)
00251     my ($stmt, @val_order) = $self->sql->update($self->table, $values);
00252     (substr($stmt,length($stmt),0), my @where_order) = $self->sql->where($where);
00253     
00254     # append physical set_id match clause
00255     $stmt .= " AND " . $self->sql->_quote("set_id") . " = " . make_vsetID_sql("?","?");
00256     push @where_order, $set_id_index, $version_id_index;
00257     
00258     my $sth = $self->dbh->prepare_cached($stmt, undef, 3); # 3: see DBI docs
00259     return $sth, \@val_order, \@where_order;
00260 }
00261 
00262 # don't need to override delete_where, since it'll get a pre-converted where clause
00263 #sub delete_where;
00264 
00265 # pretty much the same modification as _update_fields_prep
00266 # this is mostly a copy of Std::_delete_fields_prep
00267 sub _delete_fields_prep {
00268     my ($self, $fields) = @_;
00269     
00270     # get hashes to pass to update() and where()
00271     # (dies if any keyfield is missing from @$fields)
00272     my (undef, $where) = $self->gen_update_hashes($fields);
00273     
00274     # grab bind order for set_id/version_id virtual fields
00275     my $set_id_index = $where->{set_id};
00276     my $version_id_index = $where->{version_id};
00277     delete @$where{qw/set_id version_id/};
00278     
00279     # do the where clause separately so we get a separate bind list (cute substr trick, huh?)
00280     my ($stmt, @order) = $self->sql->delete($self->table, $where);
00281     
00282     # append physical set_id match clause
00283     $stmt .= " AND " . $self->sql->_quote("set_id") . " = " . make_vsetID_sql("?","?");
00284     push @order, $set_id_index, $version_id_index;
00285     
00286     print STDERR "stmt=$stmt\norder=@order\n";
00287     my $sth = $self->dbh->prepare_cached($stmt, undef, 3); # 3: see DBI docs
00288     return $sth, @order;
00289 }
